title: Whatever Happened to Nokia’s Purebook Laptops?
description: Nokia laptop licensee OFF Global is no more. The post Whatever Happened to Nokia’s Purebook Laptops? appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: Nokia laptop licensee OFF Global is no more.
text: A couple of years back, back, Nokia made waves when it announced a partnership with Off Global, a French start-up that specializes in the production of laptop computers to be launched under Nokia’s PureBook branding. It’s been a while since we’ve heard anything about the laptops, and it looks like Nokia has altogether ended this collaboration. READ: Tecno’s New Laptop is Powered by Qualcomm’s Snapdragon X Elite Chip As reported by the folks over at Nokiamob, Nokia’s venture into laptop licensing has come to an end following OFF Global’s closure. OFF Global’s website and LinkedIn page now indicate the company has ceased operations. It seems that despite the Nokia branding, the laptops struggled to gain significant traction especially in a competitive market dominated by veteran brands such as Lenovo, Acer, ASUS, and more. While not as massive as the closure of its licensing agreement with HMD Global, it appears that Nokia isn’t too keen on revisiting the laptop market anytime soon, at least for the time being. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. html:
A couple of years back, back, Nokia made waves when it announced a partnership with Off Global, a French start-up that specializes in the production of laptop computers to be launched under Nokia’s PureBook branding. It’s been a while since we’ve heard anything about the laptops, and it looks like Nokia has altogether ended this collaboration.

READ: Tecno’s New Laptop is Powered by Qualcomm’s Snapdragon X Elite Chip

As reported by the folks over at Nokiamob, Nokia’s venture into laptop licensing has come to an end following OFF Global’s closure. OFF Global’s website and LinkedIn page now indicate the company has ceased operations. It seems that despite the Nokia branding, the laptops struggled to gain significant traction especially in a competitive market dominated by veteran brands such as Lenovo, Acer, ASUS, and more.

While not as massive as the closure of its licensing agreement with HMD Global, it appears that Nokia isn’t too keen on revisiting the laptop market anytime soon, at least for the time being.

A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart.
